As shown in <image 1>, the fact that your cell phone is using outdated technology within a year or two of purchase is an example of ____________.

A. The conflict perspective
B. Conspicuous consumption
C. Media
D. Planned obsolescence

The correct answer is D. Planned obsolescence.

Planned obsolescence refers to the practice of designing products in such a way that they become outdated or less useful before their physical wear and tear would normally dictate their replacement. This is often done to encourage consumers to buy new products more frequently. The image shows various outdated cell phones, which suggests that they were designed to become obsolete within a short period after purchase, aligning with the concept of planned obsolescence.
